reviews.title: Unpretentious
reviews.text: We have stayed at Old Tom on two occasions now and it has always been welcoming. The owners and staff are friendly and helpful, good food and comfortable rooms. Much more preferable than some of the 'plastic' hotels we seem to find these days!

reviews.title: Best suppers on a months trip.
reviews.text: A friend and I stayed at the Old Tom for two nights in May/05. It was my second visit, having been there in 1995 for two nights as well. Absolutely no complaints! As others have noted, the rooms are relatively small but adequate, with comfortable beds to stretch out on after long days touring the Ypres salient. The restaurant cuisine was the best value we experienced in a months stay in Holland, Belgium and France; the meals being delicious, generous of proportion and very reasonably priced compared to the rest of Northern Europe. I have a good appetite and I could just barely finish a magnificent ragout one evening. The staff were courteous and friendly. Safe overnight parking is available at no cost in the town square right across the street. Everything of interest within the town of Ypres is within walking distance of the hotel. I will be returning to this fascinating area and I hope to enjoy the comforts of the Old Tom once again.

We have just returned to england after a very pleasant stay at The Old Tom. The staff were excelant , very pleasant and helpful, and the food was also of a very high standard. We shall be staying there again in the near future
reviews.title: good trip
Character with Comfort!
reviews.text: We called in at Old Tom in July 2004 not having made a reservation but were lucky enough to book in.We stayed for three nights to explore the Ypres area and the friendliness and excellent service at this small, family hotel greatly added to our enjoyment. The food is second-to-none and overall the hotel is very good value. We would most certainly stay again in the future.

reviews.title: Good Old Tom
reviews.text: We stayed at the Old Tom last March. The weather wasn't good but the staff made up for it, nothing seemed too much bother. The hotel may not be the last word in luxury but it was clean and the meals were good and we never felt unwelcom. Looking forward to my next visit in March.

All the other reviews seem to say it all. I don't know where the Canadian from Toronto [----] stayed, he must have got his hotels mixed up. Old Tom is a family run hotel and the family is very hard working, because the hotel is so very popular, especially their cafe bar and restaurant. All the family made us feel welcome throughout the duration fo our stay. Because they are busy serving other guests you do not always get immediate service.
reviews.title: Hard Working
Pleasant stay
reviews.text: However, the Hotel is very reasonable priced, especially the demi pension rate and I reccommend eating in the restaurant. The food is excellent and it saves walking around looking for other places. You can tell Old Tom's is a good place because it is the most full of the nearby restaurants. I know I checked them out.

reviews.title: Recommend
reviews.text: Phillippe appeard to be in charge and he is amazing in his work effort. Always on the go. Yet alway had a word or smile as he passes by. There are locked garages available, or you can park in the square. By the way there are three floors, so if you do not want the top floor, I advise you to visit "Old Tom" and book well in advance your room and your meal.

reviews.title: Central, good value
reviews.text: I have been to Ypres several times and think that the Old Tom offers the best value for money compared with the other hotels I have stayed in ('t Zweerd - no parking, Ariane - not so central and an uncomfortable bed, Novotel - bland). There's no lift, so getting to our room on the third floor provided plenty of exercise - not ideal for some. The bathroom was small but spotless and seemed to have been renovated recently. The room decor was a little 'tired' - but maybe they'll be updating these next. Breakfast was fine and we ate dinner here too - good portions. Give it a try.

reviews.title: Utter Crap
reviews.text: Very friendly. Very reasonably priced. Excellent Service. The rooms are clean, bathrooms have all been refitted (showers have a wee seat in them for those of us who may have scoffed a bit much Belgian beer the night before). The hotel opens out onto Ypres town square within two minutes walk from the Menin Gate.

reviews.text: Just returned from a four night stay at Old Toms.

reviews.title: Great family Hotel
reviews.text: Yes the rooms are basic ( but adequate, clean and very comfortable )

reviews.title: incredibly rude
reviews.text: But your stay at Old Toms will be made four star by the friendly staff and excellent cuisine. This is a hotel and restaurant for friendly people run by friendly people. It has perhaps the best location in Ieper - right in the grand square.

reviews.title: right in the middle
reviews.text: This was a second stay at Old Toms and it most certainly will not be the last.

reviews.title: basic but comfy!
reviews.text: Well frequented, popular resturant, food very good value for the money, unpretentious, family run Hotel and Resturant. Rooms comfortable, clean and warm, book early, they are nearly always full.
